revised_title: Ground-Ice Depressions in East Anglia: A Periglacial Phenomenon
tldr: The authors describe shallow depressions in East Anglia, formed by the freezing and thawing of ground ice under periglacial conditions. These depressions, called thermokarst, are characterized by their shallow depth, variable size, and clustered distribution. The authors compare these features to similar formations in Arctic regions, such as pingos, and discuss their geological and geographical distribution, as well as their formation process.
